com.quinsoft.zeidon

Interface View

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, TaskQualification
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ViewForwarder

    public interface View
extends TaskQualification
    A View is the main interface for manipulating Zeidon data organized in Object Instances (OIs). A view is a set of EntityCursors, one for each entity specified in the LOD. The EntityCursor is used to scan through existing Entity Instances in an OI.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getApplication

        Application getApplication()
        Returns the application for this View. The logic is as follows: 1) Gets the application of the LodDef. If this application is not ZeidonSystem, then it returns the application. 2) If the LodDef belongs to ZeidonSystem, then the default application of the parent task is returned.
        Specified by:
        getApplication in interface TaskQualification
        Returns:
        the default application for this task.

      • getLodDef

        LodDef getLodDef()
        Returns the LodDef for this View.
        Returns:
        the LodDef for this view.

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly()
        Returns 'true' if this View is read-only. A read-only view can not be used to update the underlying OI. It is possible for a different view to update the same OI.
        Returns:
        true if this View is read-only.

      • setReadOnly

        void setReadOnly(boolean readOnly)
        Used to set the read-only flag for this view.
        Parameters:
        readOnly - if 'true' then this View will be read-only.

      • isAllowHiddenEntities

        boolean isAllowHiddenEntities()
        If true then allow cursors to refer to hidden entities without throwing an exception. Intended to be used by DBHandlers.
        Returns:
        true if the view can reference hidden (e.g. deleted) entities.

      • setAllowHiddenEntities

        boolean setAllowHiddenEntities(boolean allowHiddenEntities)
        If set to true then this view can reference hidden entities without throwing an exception. Intended to be used by DBHandlers.
        Parameters:
        allowHiddenEntities -
        Returns:
        the previous value of allowHiddenEntities.

        Returns an ID for the view that is unique for the JVM.
        Returns:
        unique key.

      • getOiId

        long getOiId()
        Return an ID that is unique for this OI. Different views that reference the same OI will return the same OI ID.
        Returns:

      • getHierEntityList

        Iterable<EntityInstance> getHierEntityList()
        Loops through all the entities in the OI in hierarchical order. Sets the cursors.
        Returns:
        Iterable list of entity instances.

      • getHierEntityList

        Iterable<EntityInstance> getHierEntityList(boolean includeRoot)
        Loops through all the entities in the OI in hierarchical order. Sets the cursors.
        Parameters:
        includeRoot - If false, then skip the root.
        Returns:
        Iterable list of entity instances.

      • getHierEntityList

        Iterable<EntityInstance> getHierEntityList(boolean includeRoot,
                                           String entityName)
        Loops through all the entities in the OI that match entityName in hierarchical order. Sets the cursors.
        Parameters:
        includeRoot - If false, then skip the root.
        entityName - If non-blank, then limit entities to this.
        Returns:
        Iterable list of entity instances.

      • getEntityByHierPosition

        EntityInstance getEntityByHierPosition(long position)
        Returns the entity instance by hierarchical positioning. Excludes hidden entities, root = 0.

      • newView

        View newView()
        Create a new view from the existing view and set the cursors to be the same. This method is thread-safe, meaning that multiple threads can create a new view from the same one.
        Returns:
        new view.

      • newView

        View newView(TaskQualification owningTask)
        Create a new view but set its owning task to a different task. This method is thread-safe, meaning that multiple threads can create a new view from the same one.
        Parameters:
        owningTask - the view will be assigned to this task.
        Returns:

      • newView

        View newView(boolean readOnly)
        Create a new view. If readOnly is true then the new view will be read-only. This method is thread-safe, meaning that multiple threads can create a new view from the same one.
        Parameters:
        readOnly - if true then the new view will be read-only
        Returns:
        new view.

      • newView

        View newView(TaskQualification owningTask,
             boolean readOnly)
        Create a new view. If readOnly is true then the new view will be read-only. The owning task is specified by owningTask. This method is thread-safe, meaning that multiple threads can create a new view from the same one.
        Parameters:
        owningTask - the view will be assigned to this task.
        readOnly - if true then the new view will be read-only
        Returns:
        the new view.

      • duplicateOi

        View duplicateOi()
        Creates a new Object Instance by copying or including the entity instances from this view. Whether an entity instance is created or included form the source OI is dependent on the permissions as specified in the LOD.
        Returns:
        duplicated OI.

      • duplicateOi

        View duplicateOi(DuplicateOiOptions options)
        Creates a new Object Instance by copying or including the entity instances from this view. Whether an entity instance is created or included form the source OI is dependent on the permissions as specified in the LOD.
        Parameters:
        options -
        Returns:

      • activateOiFromOi

        View activateOiFromOi(ActivateFlags flag)

      • getActivateOptions

        ActivateOptions getActivateOptions()
        Returns:
        The ActivateOptions used to activate the OI. May return null if there was no qualification.

      • drop

        void drop()
        Drops all view names for this view and flags this view as invalid. This will only attempt to remove the view from the default application view list. If this view was named for a different application then it must be removed explicitly. Note: this only drops the view but does not drop the OI unless there are no other Views that reference the OI. Dropping a view will have no effect on other views.

      • logObjectInstance

        void logObjectInstance()
        Writes the OI to the Zeidon logs.

void displayObjectInstance()

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • validateOi

        Collection<ZeidonException> validateOi()
        Run some validations on this OI. Returns a list of validation exceptions.
        Returns:
        list of exceptions or null if there are no errors.

      • relinkOis

        int relinkOis(View... views)
        Relinks all the OIs specified in the view list with this one.
        Parameters:
        otherViews - other, optional, views that can be relinked all at once.
        Returns:
        total number of entities relinked.

      • setName

        void setName(String name)
        Sets the name for this view inside its task. This view can be retrieved by its name given its task. For example: 
        
      View view = task.activate....();
      view.setName( "MyName" );
      ...
      View anotherView = task.getViewByName( "MyName" ); // anotherView == view
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the view.

      • dropNameForView

        void dropNameForView(String name)
        Drops a name for the view. This does not drop the view.
        Parameters:
        name - name to be dropped.

      • getNameList

        Collection<String> getNameList()
        Gets the list of all names for this view.
        Returns:
        list of all names for this view.

      • getViewByNameForSubtask

        View getViewByNameForSubtask(String name)
        Retrieves a view by name that was assigned under a subtask view. See setNameForSubtaskView for more info.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of view to retrieve.
        Returns:
        named view if it exists.

      • setNameForSubtask

        void setNameForSubtask(String name,
                       View view)
        Names a view within another view (which is known as a subtask). This allows views to be grouped together under a single view. View names do not have to be unique across all views. For example: 
          View subtask1 = task.activate...();
  View subtask2 = task.activate...();
  View v1 = task.activate...();
  view v2 = task.activate...();

  subtask1.setNameForSubtask( "MyName", v1 );
  subtask2.setNameForSubtask( "MyName", v2 );

  View temp = subtask1.getViewByNameForSubtask( "MyName" ); // temp == v1
        Parameters:
        name - Name to give to subtask view.
        view - View that will be named under the subtask view.

      • dropNameForSubtask

        void dropNameForSubtask(String name,
                        View view)
        Drops the name for a subtask view.
        Parameters:
        name - Name to drop
        view - view to drop. TODO: Is this necessary?

      • getSubtaskNameList

        Collection<String> getSubtaskNameList()
        Returns the view names that have been added under this subtask.
        Returns:
        list of subtask view names.

View getViewByName(String name,

             Level level)

      • resetSubobjectTop

        void resetSubobjectTop()
        Reset the subobject cursor back to the top-level object. (I.e. cancels all subobject cursors).

      • resetSubobject

        void resetSubobject()
        Resets the subobject cursor to point to its parent.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reset all cursors in the view.

        void copyCursors(View src)
        Copy the cursor values from src view.
        Parameters:
        src - - Source view.

      • equalsOi

        boolean equalsOi(View view)
        Returns true if the Object Instance referenced by 'view' has the same entity/attributes values as this one.
        Parameters:
        view -
        Returns:

      • setLazyLoad

        void setLazyLoad(boolean lazyLoad)
        Enables/disables lazy loading for this view. Note that other views may still lazy load entities for this OI.
        Parameters:
        lazyLoad -

      • isLazyLoad

        boolean isLazyLoad()
        Returns true if the lazy-load is enabled for this View. See setLazyLoad for more.
        Returns:
        true if Lazy Load is enabled for this view.

      • isUpdated

        boolean isUpdated()
        Returns:
        true if the OI is thought to have non-persisted changes. When true this flag is not 100% accurate: an entity may be changed through this view but committed via a linked OI; in this example isUpdated() will return true even though there are no outstanding changes. If false then this OI has no changes and this is always correct.

      • isUpdatedFile

        boolean isUpdatedFile()
        Returns:
        true if this OI was updated since it was last activated from a file. If the OI was never activated from a file then it is a synonym for isUpdated().

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the OI does not have any entities.
        Returns:

      • isInternal

        boolean isInternal()
        Returns true if this view was created by internal JOE processing. This is intended to be used by the browser to ignore views that weren't created by the user.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this view was created by internal JOE processing.

      • setInternal

        View setInternal(boolean internal)
        Sets the 'internal' flag. The only effect is that this will hide the view from the browser.
        Parameters:
        internal -
        Returns:

      • getEntityCount

        int getEntityCount(boolean includeHidden)
        Return the number of entities in the OI.
        Parameters:
        includeHidden - if true, count hidden entities.
        Returns:

      • getTotalRootCount

        Integer getTotalRootCount()
        This is the total count of root entities. For OIs loaded with paging this is the total number of roots, not just the ones loaded.

      • setTotalRootCount

        void setTotalRootCount(int totalRootCount)
        Sets the total root count. Intended to be used by the dbhandler.

      • addViewCleanupWork

        void addViewCleanupWork(DropViewCleanup work)

      • getCacheMap

        CacheMap getCacheMap()
        Get the CacheMap for the View.
